de.feu.propra15.q9278273.gui

Class UndoablePoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit
      • de.feu.propra15.q9278273.gui.UndoablePoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit

    public class UndoablePoint
extends javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit
    The Class UndoablePoint. It extends AbstractUndoableEdit so that all events which are undoable can be added to the undo manager.
    Author:
    Teodor Shaterov
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • UndoablePoint

        public UndoablePoint(java.awt.Point singlePoint,
             java.util.List<java.awt.Point> list,
             boolean isDeletion,
             boolean isReplacer)
        Instantiates a new undoable point. It is used when a single point is added or deleted from the canvas.
        Parameters:
        singlePoint - the single point
        list - the list
        isDeletion - the is deletion
        isReplacer - the is replacer

      • UndoablePoint

        public UndoablePoint(java.util.List<java.awt.Point> pointList,
             java.util.List<java.awt.Point> points,
             boolean isDeletion,
             boolean isReplacer)
        Instantiates a new undoable point. It is used when more than one point is added or deleted from the canvas.
        Parameters:
        pointList - the point list
        points - the points
        isDeletion - the is deletion
        isReplacer - the is replacer

      • UndoablePoint

        public UndoablePoint(java.awt.Point startingPoint,
             java.awt.Point endPoint,
             int index,
             java.util.List<java.awt.Point> points,
             boolean isReplacer)
        Instantiates a new undoable point. It is used only when a point which is already there is moved by the user. Only the start and the end positions of the point are saved and not the many ones between this two positions.
        Parameters:
        startingPoint - the point
        endPoint - the end point
        index - the index
        points - the points
        isReplacer - the is replacer
